item.title: Cellular Automata Playground
item.description: Overview Cellular Automata has always fascinated me, and as a teenager I even programmed some recreations of Conway’s Game of Life. After getting into Houdini and seeing some beautiful rules or patterns, I wanted a way to play around with rules and create my own artworks. In particular, I was inspired by the concept of multiple rules on a singular canvas. I had seen someone implement this concept poorly, and I wanted to do it better.

item.title: Edgewalker
item.description: An example project that uses the output of the edgewalker. Algorithm The Edgewalker tool starts at a group of points, and walks along edges to neighboring points to create an edge group or polyline. A progression of snapshots of the algorithm. A frame is skipped between each stage for demonstration purposes. A progression of snapshots of the algorithm. A frame is skipped between each stage for demonstration purposes. item.title: SHNOPs Toolset
item.description: SHNOPs (visit the repo!) is an open-source toolset designed in and to use with SideFX’s Houdini. It stands for Simple Houdini Number OPerators. Its purpose is to provide a simple and cohesive framework to manipulate and analyze datasets into meaningful and interesting geometric respresentations. I was originally inspired to create this toolset when I had data of my own that I wanted to visualize and analyze myself instead of relying on another program that could do it differently or not offer the tools I wanted.
